column4: question for y'all: my firefox has a nasty habit of starting in offline mode.  How do I make it not do that?
manually configured network?
no
about:config, and set toolkit.networkmanager.disable to true
by 'manually configured', I mean anything other than network manager
oh, then yes
I set it to true, restarted firefox, and it started up in offline mode
it was online when you closed it, right?
I'm 99% sure
now I'm 100% sure
I was in online mode, shut firefox down, and it started in offline mode
toolkit.networkmanager.disable is true, right?  (:p)
yes
that's special :/
I have no idea then, although I suspect it's still something related
edit | preferences | advanced | network | settings, it's not set to auto-detect is it?
that takes me to the foxyproxy dialog box
apparently there's some logic in there that might be doing an actual network test.  Try starting in -safe-mode, or otherwise disabling foxyproxy temporarily to check if that's causing an interaction
now "work offline" is unchecked [after I disabled foxyproxy]
i.e., it worked? :/
yeah
well, that's cute
